info.author: Martijn Pieters
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Library or Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
info.description:
PyRA2 is a set of Python packages (libraries) and documentation providing access
to the file formats of Robot Arena 2 (tm) (RA2), a game by Gabriel Interactive
(published by Infogrames). RA2 allows a player to design new robots (consisting
of a chassis and a set of components), and use these robots to fight
computer-controlled robots and, in a multi-player setting, the robot designs of
other players. For more information about this game, see
http://www.robotarena.com/.

Goals of PyRA2 are:

 - Enabling a robot design exchange website for the player community, with VRML
   previews of available robots.
 
 - Modification and creation of robot designs outside of RA2.
 
 - Modification and creation of new components and arenas.
info.name: PyRA2
info.summary: Python support for Robot Arena 2 file formats.
info.html_description:
PyRA2 is a set of Python packages (libraries) and documentation providing access to the file formats of Robot Arena 2 (tm) (RA2), a game by Gabriel Interactive (published by Infogrames). RA2 allows a player to design new robots (consisting of a chassis and a set of components), and use these robots to fight computer-controlled robots and, in a multi-player setting, the robot designs of other players. For more information about this game, see http://www.robotarena.com/.

Goals of PyRA2 are:

  • Enabling a robot design exchange website for the player community, with VRML previews of available robots.
  • Modification and creation of robot designs outside of RA2.
  • Modification and creation of new components and arenas.
